query: The Crusher gravel race Upper Peninsula

videos.title: What is "The Crusher" Enhanced Gravel Race?
videos.description:
The Crushers is an Enhanced Gravel Race that takes place in the Beautiful Upper Peninsula of Michigan. The term enhanced is used to stress the difficult terrain that promises a grueling yet exhilarting experience like any other. This event has several distances and the longest known iteration is about 325 miles. The course changes every year and spans a mix of gravel roads, rugged two-tracks and pavement with spans of steep incline that will require even the most experienced riders to walk all their gear several miles up and down hill. The course changes every year and rout information is provide 1-2 months prior to the mass start. This is considered "part of the fun" as it ensures no two crushers are the same.  

The Crusher has both a Scheduled mass start and a expedition event that people can run on their own. In either case the event is self guided with no formal aid stations or support although you may find aid form your own community, volunteers or other riders. Riders are provided a field guide which provides details of the event, complete with a gear list and required checkpoints that must be knocked off to complete the event. The event aims to embrace the spirit of adventure and exploration while seeing what people are capable of by pushing them to their absolute limit. 

Everybody comes to this event for their own reason, some to race, some to avoid therapy and others to have an adventure. Regardless of your reason the even organizers want you to know its you vs The Crusher. Those who quit mid event have to text #quiter to the race directors as a cruel but comical way force riders to sit down and admit defeat.

This event along with the "Polar Roll" and the Marji Gesick" make up the 906 Adventure Teams endurance Trilogy known as the Triple Crown. The biggest bike adventure seekers who complete these three events are added into the "Hall of Pain" and become eligible to attend an annual "secret event"

The Crusher is a bucket list of gravel races that draws attention to the beauty and challenges of Michigans Upper Peninsula built on the idea of pushing your limits in every aspect of life which we try to capture on the Type 2 Fun Channel.

In the words of The Crusher's Race Director Todd Poquette - "There is no finish" line"

Link to some recommended gear from our guests across a variety of activities!
https://app.rockporch.com/Profile/Type2Fun

videos.title: The Crusher MS 40 (7-19-2025)
videos.description:
TLDR: CRUSHED IT! From "Oh $#*!" to "HELL YEAH!" at The Crusher!

Folks, I've had a few days to process 54 miles of pure Upper Peninsula grit at The Crusher, and honestly, it still feels like a wild fever dream. But the numbers don't lie: I absolutely annihilated my estimated finish time, crossing that line in just 10 hours and 25 minutes! That's almost 8 hours faster than I thought possible! This isn't just about finishing; it's a testament to embracing the "fail fast, fail up" mindset we champion.

My journey to The Crusher was paved with challenges, from personal battles with ADHD/OCD and addiction to the heartbreaking loss of my brother this year. Life throws punches, and believe me, I've taken a few. My experience at Polar Roll earlier this year was a prime example – I failed. Hard. But instead of letting it define me, that "failure" became the fuel for clarity and fierce determination. It taught me invaluable lessons about preparation and resilience, proving that true growth only comes when you learn to fall forward. We all fail; it's how we get back up and share those lessons that truly matters.

The drive to Copper Harbor, the pre-race massage, even the pre-dawn kielbasa and bacon fuel-up – every detail was part of the build-up. But the real magic happened on the trails. My strategy evolved from complex data points to simple truths: 
 
 * Go slow, enjoy the ride, take pictures!
 * Eat snacks, meet people and share stories.
 * Be the reason someone else crosses the finish line."

This philosophy connected me with incredible humans on the course. From Barry Tilson, who literally shared his campsite, to Derrick, who found my phone on the Highlands Trail (talk about a collective "oh sh*t" moment turning into pure relief!). Every shared water bottle, every cheer, every laugh with strangers and friends alike underscored the power of community.

The Keweenaw Point and Highlands trails were pure joy – meticulously manicured and insanely fast, allowing for "giggling and shouting" sessions as I pumped through technical sections. This ride wasn't just about physical endurance; it was a vibrant reminder that the greatest reward in these adventures isn't just the personal accomplishment, but the connections forged and the stories shared. The trail builders deserve all the beers! I've got a ridiculous amount of GoPro footage (fair warning for colorful language!) that captures these incredible moments and the amazing people I met. I tried to make sure everyone was represented.

At Crash Test Cleveland, I believe every challenge, every "failure," is an opportunity for a breakthrough. My Crusher experience is living proof. What "failures" have taught you the most? Share your stories below! Let's build this community of resilience together!
#CrashTestCleveland #TheCrusher #MountainBiking #EmbraceFailure #Community #LearnFromExperience #Grit #CopperHarbor #Adventure #GrowthMindset
